sentence.Network_en: He pleaded guilty to wilful dereliction of duty.
sentence.Network_cn: 他承认犯有玩忽职守罪。

sentence.Network_en: The previous owners had rescued the building from dereliction.
sentence.Network_cn: 这座建筑之前的业主将其从破败不堪的状况中挽救了出来。

sentence.Network_en: The law clearly stipulates criminal sanctions for any prison staff guilty of dereliction of duty.
sentence.Network_cn: 对监管工作人员的渎职犯罪,法律明确规定应给予刑事制裁.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin derelictio(n-), from the verb derelinquere (see derelict)

entry.def: If a building or a piece of land is in a state of dereliction, it is deserted or abandoned.

example.ex: The previous owners had rescued the building from dereliction.
example.tran: 这座建筑之前的业主将其从破败不堪的状况中挽救了出来。

means.word_mean: 1. a tendency to be negligent and uncaring;

sentences.sentence: "he inherited his delinquency from his father"
"his derelictions were not really intended as crimes"
"his adolescent protest consisted of willful neglect of all his responsibilities"
